org.sd.cluster.job
Class AbstractJob

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.cluster.job.AbstractJob
All Implemented Interfaces:
Clusterable, Message, Job, Publishable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractCountingJob, EmptyJob, JobOutputProcessor, OldAbstractJob, SteadyStateJob, WorkJob, WorkServer
public abstract class AbstractJob
extends java.lang.Object
implements Job

A job is a type of message handled by a cluster node.

When handled, a job registers with a manager to allow following progress.

Author:
Spence Koehler

getResponse

public Message getResponse(Context context)
Get this message's response to be returned by the server to the client.

NOTE: this response is returned synchronously from a server to the client after receiving a message. The message as received on the server is handled in its own thread later.

Specified by:
getResponse in interface Message
Parameters:
context - The context of the server responding to this message.

canHandle

protected final boolean canHandle()
Returns true if this job has responded and did not have an error while responding.

setError

protected final void setError(boolean error)

preHandleHook

protected boolean preHandleHook(Context context)
Called by the handle method only if 'canHandle' returns true before registering this job with the job manager. If this hook returns false, this job will NOT be registered with the job manager and the postHandleHook will not be called.

postHandleHook

protected void postHandleHook(Context context)
Called by the handle method after registering with the job manager.

handle

public final void handle(Context context)
Description copied from interface: Message
Handle this message on the server.

NOTE: The message received on a server is handled asynchronously through this method after its response has been sent back to the client.

Specified by:
handle in interface Message
Parameters:
context - The context of the server on which this message is being handled.

getJobManager

public JobManager getJobManager()
Get the job manager.

NOTE: this is only available after the preHandleHook has been run!

getConsole

public Console getConsole()
Get a handle to the job manager's console.

NOTE: this is only available after the preHandleHook has been run!

read

public void read(java.io.DataInput dataInput)
          throws java.io.IOException
Read this message's contents from the dataInput stream that was written by this.write(dataOutput).

NOTE: this requires all implementing classes to have a default constructor with no args.

Specified by:
read in interface Publishable
Parameters:
dataInput - the data output to write to.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

startHandlingHook

protected boolean startHandlingHook()
Hook called when we start handling the job.

A common operation is to initialize the totalOps.

Returns:
true to start handling right away; false to delay handling until manually started.

setClusterContext

public void setClusterContext(ClusterContext context)
Description copied from interface: Clusterable
Set this clusterable's clusterContext.

Note that this is not set until a cluster node's node server handles a message that uses this clusterable object and the message passes the context along to this clusterable object.

Specified by:
setClusterContext in interface Clusterable
Parameters:
context - this object's clusterContext.
